simplified:
NASA is trying to find and track smaller asteroids that are 140 meters across or more.  
Scientists think there are about 25,000 of these.  
So far, about 8,000 have been found, so about 17,000 are still not found.  
In 2013, a 19-meter asteroid exploded in the air over a city in Russia and hurt 1,200 people.  
This shows that medium-size asteroids can be dangerous if they come near Earth.

translate.raw_output: 美国航天局正在努力记录一些较小的小行星，它们的宽度在140米以上。估计这类小行星大约有25000颗；现在只记录了大约8000颗，还剩下大约17000颗没有记录。2013年，在俄罗斯一座城市上空，一个宽19米的小行星爆炸，造成1200人受伤。所以，如果这些中等大小的小行星接近地球，就会很危险。
translate.clean_output: 美国航天局正在努力记录一些较小的小行星，它们的宽度在140米以上。估计这类小行星大约有25000颗；现在只记录了大约8000颗，还剩下大约17000颗没有记录。2013年，在俄罗斯一座城市上空，一个宽19米的小行星爆炸，造成1200人受伤。所以，如果这些中等大小的小行星接近地球，就会很危险。
translate.prompt:
Please translate the following English paragraph into Chinese and simplify it for A2-CEFR-level learners of Chinese. Return only the Chinese paragraph, without explanation or extra text.

English Text: Now NASA is working towards logging some of the smaller asteroids, those measuring 140 metres wide or more. Of the 25,000 estimated asteroids of this size, so far about 8,000 have been logged, leaving 17,000 unaccounted for. Considering that a 19-metre asteroid that exploded above the city of Chelyabinsk in Russia in 2013 injured 1,200 people, these middle-sized asteroids would be a serious danger if they enter Earth's orbit.
Translation:

translate_and_simplify.raw_output:
NASA is trying to find and track smaller asteroids that are 140 meters across or more.  
Scientists think there are about 25,000 of these.  
So far, about 8,000 have been found, so about 17,000 are still not found.  
In 2013, a 19-meter asteroid exploded in the air over a city in Russia and hurt 1,200 people.  
This shows that medium-size asteroids can be dangerous if they come near Earth.

This shows that medium-size asteroids could be a serious danger if they come near Earth.

translate.raw_output: Derzeit arbeitet die NASA daran, einen Teil der kleineren Asteroiden zu erfassen, nämlich jene mit einem Durchmesser von 140 Metern oder mehr. Von den auf 25.000 geschätzten Asteroiden dieser Größe sind bisher etwa 8.000 katalogisiert worden; rund 17.000 sind noch unentdeckt. Angesichts der Tatsache, dass ein 19-Meter-Asteroid, der 2013 über der russischen Stadt Tscheljabinsk explodierte, 1.200 Menschen verletzte, würden diese mittelgroßen Asteroiden eine ernsthafte Gefahr darstellen, wenn sie in die Erdumlaufbahn gelangen.

The whole nation is forced to watch the event on television.

simplified: In many cities and towns, people often see small animals like birds, squirrels, rats, and bugs. But in recent years, news around the world says more wild animals are coming into cities. There are bears in parks in Vancouver, leopards on the streets of Mumbai, and wild pigs in gardens in Berlin. What happens when big animals come into the city? Do people welcome them, or do they think they are dangerous and will cause problems?

translate.raw_output: 在很多城市和小镇，人们常常看到小动物，比如鸟、松鼠、老鼠和虫子。可是这几年，世界各地的新闻常说：进城的野生动物越来越多。温哥华的公园里有熊，孟买的街上有豹子，柏林的花园里有野猪。大的动物进到城市，会怎么样？人们欢迎它们吗？还是觉得它们有危险，或者会带来麻烦？
translate.clean_output: 在很多城市和小镇，人们常常看到小动物，比如鸟、松鼠、老鼠和虫子。可是这几年，世界各地的新闻常说：进城的野生动物越来越多。温哥华的公园里有熊，孟买的街上有豹子，柏林的花园里有野猪。大的动物进到城市，会怎么样？人们欢迎它们吗？还是觉得它们有危险，或者会带来麻烦？

simplified: A potentially dangerous asteroid is one that passes within 7.5 million kilometers of Earth. NASA made a map showing 1,400 of these asteroids. None of them will threaten us in the next 100 years. With today’s technology, NASA can track them and predict if they might hit Earth. If one ever becomes dangerous, there are two ways to protect our planet.

translate.raw_output: 可能有危险的小行星，是会在离地球轨道750万公里以内经过的小行星。美国航天局做了一张地图，标出了一千四百颗这样的少行星。在未来一百年里，它们都不会对我们造成威胁。用现在的技术，美国航天局可以追踪它们，也可以预测它们会不会撞到地球。如果真的有危险，可以用两种办法来保护地球。

English Text: Potentially Hazardous Asteroids' are rocks close enough to pass within 7.5 million kilometres of Earth's orbit. NASA has created a map of 1,400 PHAs, none of which are expected to be a threat in the next one hundred years. With technology already available, NASA can track these objects and make predictions about possible impact, at which point two defence solutions could be launched.

If one ever becomes dangerous, there are two ways to protect our planet.

Simplified English Text:

simplified: Potentially hazardous asteroids (PHAs) are space rocks that can come as close as 7.5 million kilometers (about 4.7 million miles) to Earth’s orbit. NASA has mapped 1,400 PHAs, and none is expected to threaten Earth in the next 100 years. With current technology, NASA can track these objects and predict possible impacts. If needed, two types of defense actions could be used.

translate.raw_output: Potenziell gefährliche Asteroiden (PHAs) sind Gesteinskörper, die bis auf 7,5 Millionen Kilometer an die Umlaufbahn der Erde herankommen können. Die NASA hat eine Karte mit 1.400 PHAs erstellt, von denen voraussichtlich keiner in den nächsten hundert Jahren eine Bedrohung darstellt. Mit bereits verfügbarer Technologie kann die NASA diese Objekte verfolgen und Vorhersagen über mögliche Einschläge treffen; dann könnten zwei Abwehrmaßnahmen eingeleitet werden.
translate.clean_output: Potenziell gefährliche Asteroiden (PHAs) sind Gesteinskörper, die bis auf 7,5 Millionen Kilometer an die Umlaufbahn der Erde herankommen können. Die NASA hat eine Karte mit 1.400 PHAs erstellt, von denen voraussichtlich keiner in den nächsten hundert Jahren eine Bedrohung darstellt. Mit bereits verfügbarer Technologie kann die NASA diese Objekte verfolgen und Vorhersagen über mögliche Einschläge treffen; dann könnten zwei Abwehrmaßnahmen eingeleitet werden.

English Text: Potentially Hazardous Asteroids' are rocks close enough to pass within 7.5 million kilometres of Earth's orbit. NASA has created a map of 1,400 PHAs, none of which are expected to be a threat in the next one hundred years. With technology already available, NASA can track these objects and make predictions about possible impact, at which point two defence solutions could be launched.

translate_and_simplify.raw_output: Potentially hazardous asteroids (PHAs) are space rocks that can come as close as 7.5 million kilometers (about 4.7 million miles) to Earth’s orbit. NASA has mapped 1,400 PHAs, and none is expected to threaten Earth in the next 100 years. With current technology, NASA can track these objects and predict possible impacts. If needed, two types of defense actions could be used.
